intro: Cyrtandra wariana, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra wariana is an important species in Hawaiian botany and is often found in conservation efforts due to its limited distribution.
